greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = first i >= 1 for which the Kronecker symbol K(i,n) is not +1 (i.e., is either 0 or -1), 0 if no such i exists.
comment: a(1) = 0, because K(i,1) is 1 for all i. After that, A112046 interleaved with A007395.

All terms beyond a(1) = 0 are prime numbers. Heuristically a(n) is 2 3/4 of the time, 3 1/6 of the time, 5 1/20 of the time, 7 2/105 of the time, etc. The average value is 2.5738775742512.... - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 30 2018
link: Antti Karttuner and A.H.M. Smeets, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20163 (first 87 terms from Antti Karttuner)
formula: a(2n+1) = A112046(n) for all n>0. - _A.H.M. Smeets_ Jan 29 2018
xref: Bisections: A112046 (for odd terms from 3 onward), A007395 (all even terms).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 06 2013
